item.title: A 'throwback' to Man Utd's past, defensive chaos and a classic
item.description: A remarkable, chaotic, mesmerising Premier League thriller at Old Trafford between Manchester United and Bournemouth captures the imagination of all those present - even the two head coaches.

item.title: Man Utd midfielder's half-brother wears 'Free Kobbie Mainoo' T-shirt
item.description: A T-shirt worn by Kobbie Mainoo's half-brother was among the post-match talking points at Old Trafford - even after a game as thrilling as the 4-4 draw between Manchester United and Bournemouth.

item.title: Where does Old Trafford thriller rank among best Premier League games?
item.description: Manchester United and Bournemouth played out a rollercoaster 4-4 draw at Old Trafford on Monday. But where does it rank among the greatest games in Premier League history?

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: Rohl's Rangers roll on - should Celtic & Hearts be worried?
item.description: BBC Scotland examines how Rangers have recovered domestically under Danny Rohl.

item.title: Holders Chelsea to host Palace in Women's FA Cup fourth round
item.description: Holders Chelsea are handed a home tie against Crystal Palace in the draw for the fourth round of the Women's FA Cup.

item.title: Man City to target Guehi in summer - Tuesday's gossip
item.description: Manchester City will target Marc Guehi next summer, three Premier League clubs are eyeing Daniel Munoz, Manchester United will try to sign Conor Gallagher in January, plus more.

item.title: Pep proteges reunite as Chelsea face Cardiff
item.description: Pep Guardiola proteges Enzo Maresca and Brian Barry-Murphy will reunite when Chelsea face Cardiff City in their EFL Cup quarter-final.

item.title: Watch Man Utd and Bournemouth's eight-goal thriller
item.description: Bournemouth's Junior Kroupi scores the equaliser in a dramatic 4-4 draw against Manchester United at Old Trafford, after two quick-fire goals from United's Bruno Fernandes and Matheus Cunha put the hosts in front.

item.title: Rogers' 'brilliant strike' helps Villa keep pressure on top two
item.description: Aston Villa came from behind to win against West Ham, a Morgan Rogers beauty completing the comeback to keep up Villa's fine form.

item.title: More pressure piled on Frank as Forest outclass Spurs
item.description: Callum Hudson-Odoi and Ibrahim Sangare combine for three goals as Nottingham Forest outclass Tottenham at the City Ground.

item.title: Haaland scores twice as Man City win at Crystal Palace
item.description: Erling Haaland scores twice to help Manchester City dispatch Crystal Palace and maintain the pressure on Premier League leaders Arsenal.

item.title: Woltemade own goal gives Sunderland win over Newcastle
item.description: Nick Woltemade puts through his own net as Sunderland enjoy a derby win to remember against arch-rivals Newcastle United.

item.title: Where did it all go wrong for Kettlewell at Kilmarnock?
item.description: BBC Scotland looks at where it all went wrong for Stuart Kettlewell at Kilmarnock, and who the fans want next.

item.title: Maresca 'happy' at Chelsea but wounds remain open
item.description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca is evasive when asked to explain his claim that he has endured his "worst 48 hours" at the club and lacked support.

item.title: What fans, insiders and stats say about embattled Frank
item.description: Tottenham have lost as many league games as they have won this season under Thomas Frank, with some fans criticising his style of play. BBC Sport assesses Spurs' struggles under their new manager.

item.title: How Messi's GOAT tour of India hit trouble
item.description: From crowd violence on day one to meeting cricket royalty and kickabouts with kids - what happened on Lionel Messi's GOAT Tour of India.

item.title: Burn suffers broken rib and punctured lung
item.description: Newcastle United defender Dan Burn is set for a spell out of action after suffering a broken rib and punctured lung during the derby defeat against Sunderland.

item.title: Amorim 'really disappointed' to draw 'fun game'
item.description: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim says his team "lost two points" in a helter-skelter 4-4 Premier League draw against Bournemouth. United led three times but had to settle for a point.

item.title: A lot of positives for Bournemouth in draw - Iraola
item.description: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola says his team can take positives from their 4-4 draw at Manchester United, but that there are also "some things to correct" from the performance.

item.title: How 'influential' Rogers sets the tone for Aston Villa
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Theo Walcott and Joe Hart look at how "composed and confident" Morgan Rogers "set the tone" for Aston Villa in their 3-2 comeback win over West Ham.

item.title: How Man City were able to beat a spirited Crystal Palace
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Theo Walcott and Joe Hart look at how Manchester City's backline were able to hold off Crystal Palace before Erling Haaland and Phil Foden went on to win the game at Selhurst Park.

item.title: How Dyche has Forest's forwards firing
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Theo Walcott and Joe Hart analyse how Sean Dyche has turned Nottingham Forest into a potent attacking side.

item.title: Clarke urges fans not to go into debt for World Cup tickets
item.description: Steve Clarke is urging Scotland fans not to put themselves into debt to follow their team to the World Cup.

item.title: Timing or tactics - what's gone wrong of late at Celtic?
item.description: Celtic supporters have had their say about Celtic's recent slump.

item.title: Paul Doyle said he 'just panicked' in Liverpool parade attack
item.description: The Liverpool parade attacker considered himself "the most important person" in the area, a court hears.

item.title: Arsenal fear White will be out for over a month
item.description: Arsenal fear defender Ben White faces a minimum of a month out after suffering a hamstring injury in their win over Wolves.

item.title: O'Neill 'would happily have stayed on' at Celtic
item.description: Martin O'Neill says he would "happily have stayed on" as Celtic manager after his interim spell ended with seven wins out of eight games.

item.title: Bogle opens up about painkiller addiction & rehab
item.description: Crewe Alexandra forward Omar Bogle says he can see a future for himself again after a battle with addiction to painkillers and alcohol.

item.title: Rodgers close to joining Saudi club Al-Qadsiah
item.description: Brendan Rodgers is set to be appointed as manager of Saudi Pro League side Al-Qadsiah.

item.title: Farke delighted with 'unbelievable human' Calvert-Lewin
item.description: Leeds manager Daniel Farke praises goalscorer Dominic Calvert-Lewin after the striker rescues a point against Brentford at the Gtech Community Stadium.

item.title: 'Fair result' - Andrews on Brentford draw with Leeds
item.description: Brentford manager Keith Andrews says a point each was deserved after their 1-1 draw with Leeds at Gtech Community Stadium.

item.title: Performance and result a 'step backwards' - Frank
item.description: Tottenham boss Thomas Frank was disappointed with his side's "disjointed" display in their 3-0 loss to Nottingham Forest at the City Ground.

item.title: Shaw scores four as Man City thrash Aston Villa
item.description: Khadija Shaw scores four goals as Manchester City beat Aston Villa to ensure they will take a six-point lead in the Women's Super League into 2026.

item.title: Man Utd fight back from 3-0 down to draw with Spurs
item.description: Fridolina Rolfo scores a 94th-minute equaliser as Manchester Unitedfight back from 3-0 down to claim a 3-3 draw with Tottenham at the Progress with Unity Stadium Stadium.

item.title: Can you name every nation at Afcon 2025?
item.description: With the Africa Cup of Nations kicking off on Sunday, 21 December, can you name all the teams involved at this year's tournament?

item.title: Benin have point to prove at Afcon after World Cup pain
item.description: Benin arrive at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco looking to turn 2026 World Cup qualification heartbreak into a memorable continental campaign.

item.title: Should Gomez have been sent off for tackle on Wirtz?
item.description: Premier League VARs continue have a problem with red cards. And Diego Gomez's tackle on Florian Wirtz shows it.

item.title: 'The sky is the limit' - the resurgence of Calvert-Lewin
item.description: Since the Premier League returned in mid-November the Englishman has been on a mission, netting four goals in five games.

item.title: Reading women's Banduka recovering after collapse
item.description: Reading women's forward Keren Banduka is discharged from hospital after collapsing on the pitch during a league match on Sunday.

item.title: Inside Wales HQ: Bellamy's tactical masterclass
item.description: Craig Bellamy gives an insight into life as Wales head coach as he sits down with BBC Sport Wales' Feast of Football podcast.

item.title: 'No protection' for Maresca after 'premeditated' comments - Rooney
item.description: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca is unlikely to get any "protection" due to cryptic comments seemingly aimed at the club's ownership, says former Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney.

item.title: How will Afcon impact Premier League teams?
item.description: Theo Walcott and Joe Hart discuss the impact that the upcoming Afcon will have on various clubs throughout the Premier League.

item.title: Emery believes in quality of superb Rogers
item.description: Unai Emery applauds his "maturing" Aston Villa side after Morgan Rogers scores twice in the second half as they came from 2-1 down to win at West Ham.

item.title: Chelsea back to winning ways with dominant win over Brighton
item.description: Chelsea end their four-game winless streak in the Women's Super League with a comfortable 3-0 away victory against Brighton.

item.title: Performance was better than FA Cup Final - Glasner
item.description: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner feels his side played better against Manchester City in their 3-0 loss at Selhurst Park than they did when they beat Pep Guardiola's team in the FA Cup final last season.

item.title: Guardiola praises 'fantastic' players after win over Palace
item.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola reflects on a big win over Crystal Palace as his side stay within two points of top-of-the-table Arsenal.

item.title: Le Bris praises composure of Sunderland on 'intense' derby win
item.description: Regis Le Bris was happy with the energy of his young Sunderland team during their 1-0 win over Newcastle in the Tyne-Wear Derby.

item.title: Dyche praises mix of 'good football & work ethic'
item.description: Nottingham Forest boss Sean Dyche is delighted his side's pressing that left the manager "very pleased" following their 3-0 win over Tottenham at the City Ground.

item.title: 'The game that really matters' - pundits on Tyne-Wear derby
item.description: Football Focus pundits Stephen Warnock and Ashley Williams look ahead to Sunday's Tyne-Wear derby between Newcastle and Sunderland.

item.title: 'He's got to be careful' - Maresca gives targeted press conference
item.description: Enzo Maresca's press conference raises questions over whether his comments are aimed at the Chelsea board.

item.title: How Arsenal are constantly a threat from crosses
item.description: Alan Shearer praises Arsenal's directness and willingness to put crosses into the box during their late win against Wolves.

item.title: Inter Miami sign Reguilon on free transfer
item.description: Inter Miami sign former Tottenham, Real Madrid and Manchester United left-back Sergio Reguilon on a free transfer.

item.title: Man City favourites & Liverpool in trouble - how WSL stands at winter break
item.description: As the Women's Super League pauses for its winter break, BBC Sport looks at how the title race is shaping up - and who looks most likely to finish bottom come May.

item.title: Everything you need to know about Fifa Best Awards
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Fifa Best Awards are, who can vote and who the nominees are.

item.title: Palmer & Foden on target - but Rogers 'has to start' at World Cup
item.description: Phil Foden and Cole Palmer both scored this weekend - but Morgan Rogers showed why he remains England's first-choice number 10.

item.title: Sunderland recreate Newcastle team photo after 'special' derby win
item.description: Nick Woltemade's own goal was enough to give Sunderland a win over Newcastle in the first Premier League Tyne-Wear derby since 2016.

item.title: Tears & a tactical tweak - how Robinson hatched St Mirren triumph
item.description: Manager Stephen Robinson revels in a half-time change and his motivational methods as St Mirren sweep Celtic aside to win the Premier Sports Cup.

item.title: 'We have a better team than them' - Newcastle 'sorry' for derby defeat
item.description: Newcastle United captain Bruno Guimaraes says the manner of the derby loss against Sunderland was "so embarrassing".

item.title: Liverpool 'united as one' after Salah return - Van Dijk
item.description: Virgil van Dijk says Liverpool "are absolutely united and go forward as one" after Mohamed Salah returned to the squad for Saturday's win over Brighton.

item.title: 'Nightmare' Shaw's remarkable 100 goals for Man City
item.description: Khadija Shaw is a "nightmare" to play against says Aston Villa manager Natalia Arroyo after she reaches 103 goals in 120 appearances for Man City.

item.title: Henderson's Jota tribute after first league goal in four years
item.description: Brentford midfielder Jordan Henderson pays tribute to former Liverpool team-mate Diogo Jota after scoring in Sunday's draw against Leeds - his first Premier League goal since 2021.

item.title: Chelsea tormentor Robinson hopes for Cardiff upset
item.description: Cardiff forward Callum Robinson hopes to maintain his remarkable scoring record against Chelsea when they meet in their EFL Cup quarter-final.

item.title: Jolley steps down two days after fan backlash at Bury
item.description: Michael Jolley steps down as manager of non-league side Bury after just two days following a backlash against his appointment.

item.title: Six players to watch at Afcon 2025
item.description: BBC Sport Africa picks out six players to keep an eye on at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco from 21 December to 18 January.

item.title: Guardiola, a great generation, and dogs called John and Charles
item.description: Manchester City midfielder Bernardo Silva sits down with Kelly Somers to discuss his career, what he will do once he retires, and playing for Pep Guardiola.

item.title: BBC or ITV? Inside how World Cup broadcast picks are made
item.description: We now know the broadcast schedule for the 2026 World Cup, but how do BBC and ITV decide who shows which matches?

item.title: All you need to know about Afcon 2025
item.description: BBC Sport Africa provides all the information on the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations ahead of the 35th edition of the continent's biggest sporting event.

item.title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
item.description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

item.title: Haaland v Mbappe, dream ties and YMCA - the best of the World Cup draw
item.description: YMCA, Donald Trump and Kylian Mbappe v Erling Haaland - BBC Sport runs through the best bits from the World Cup draw.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why Newcastle and Sunderland don't have away fans pitchside
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Premier League sides Newcastle and Sunderland are permitted to place away fans away from pitchside.

item.title: Which Premier League teams will lose most players to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport has a look at which Premier League clubs will be most - and least - affected by the Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign

item.title: What is an ACL injury and why is it so serious?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains what an anterior cruciate ligament injury is and why they are so serious

item.title: How did Littler get Man Utd away tickets - and why has it sparked debate?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore how Luke Littler got Manchester United away tickets against Wolves on Monday evening.

item.title: Celtic back in for Bogusz & Munteanu - gossip
item.description: Previously reported targets again linked with Celtic as Kilmarnock eye Aberdeen coach with Rugby Park past...

item.title: Fiorentina take security measures after threats
item.description: Fiorentina say they have taken security measures to protect players, staff and their families after they receive "unacceptable and shameful" threats.

item.title: Fenerbahce captain's home raided in Turkish betting scandal
item.description: Players, club directors, a commentator and a referee are among the latest to be arrested in Turkey's betting scandal.

item.title: Unlucky own goal helps Gladbach beat Mainz
item.description: Watch highlights, as the Bundesliga's bottom side Mainz 05 suffer a narrow defeat to Borussia Monchengladbach.

item.title: Real's Courtois asks fans to stop abuse of players
item.description: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois urges supporters to show players more "respect" after team-mate Vinicius Jr is once again the target of abuse by fans.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
